title.narrative: EDUCATION SECTOR ANALYSIS, PLANNING ANDCOORDINATION

description.narrative: Education authorities have increased capacity in evidence-based national and decentralized sector analysis, planning, coordination and management, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EDUCATION outcome: Girls and boys of school age especially vulnerable children in deprived provinces and areas, access primary education that is progressively child friendly and demonstrates improved learning outcomes.

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education authorities have increased capacity in evidence-based national and decentralized sector analysis, planning,coordination and management

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the development of Afghanistan Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF) under the “People” Strategic Priority Area 2. In line with UNSDCF, the Education Program Strategic Note (2022-2025) was developed, presenting the rationale;and strategic direction for UNICEF’s education interventions. In the wake of recent developments in the country, the finalization of the CPD/UNSDCF was delayed and new frameworks were developed. UNICEF plays a leading role in the development of the Afghanistan Education Sector Transitional Framework that aims to bridge humanitarian and development efforts in the current politically evolving situation to keep the education system afloat. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
